briefTitle: Study of Antidepressants in Parkinson's Disease

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

To be eligible you must be:

* 30 years old or older
* diagnosed with Parkinson's disease
* experiencing symptoms of depression such as sadness, decreased energy, or problems sleeping

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D) Scores
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression over 12 weeks. Hamilton Depression Rating Scale ranges from 0-50. Higher scores represent more significant depression. Mild depression ranges from 8-13, moderate depression from 14-18, severe 19-22 and very severe any score over 23.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS)
outcomeMeasures.description: Montgomery-Asberg Depression Rating Scale ranges from 0-60. Higher score indicates more severe depression. 0-6 normal, 7-19 mild depression, 20-34 moderate depression, greater than 34 severe depression.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Beck Depression Inventory II (BDI-II)
outcomeMeasures.description: Beck Depression Inventory II ranges from 0-63. Higher score indicates more severe depression. 0-13 minimal depression, 14-19 mild depression, 20-28 moderate depression, 29-63 severe depression.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Geriatric Depression Rating Scale (GDS)
outcomeMeasures.description: Geriatric Depression Scale ranges from 0-30. Higher score indicates more severe depression. 0-9 normal, 10-19 mild depression, 20-30 severe depression.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale (BPRS)
outcomeMeasures.description: Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale. Maximum score 126. Higher score indicates greater psychiatric difficulties.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS)
outcomeMeasures.description: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale. Higher score indicates more severe Parkinson's disease symptoms. Total maximum = 176. Mental maximum = 52, Activities of Daily Living maximum = 52, Motor maximum = 72. Minimum = 0.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Snaith Clinical Anxiety Scale (CAS)
outcomeMeasures.description: Snaith Clinical Anxiety Scale. Range 0-21. Higher scores indicate increased anxiety. Score greater than 8 indicates clinical anxiety.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI)
outcomeMeasures.description: Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index scores range from 0-21, with higher scores indicating severe sleep difficulties.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) - Motor
outcomeMeasures.description: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale - Motor has a maximum score of 72, minimum score of 0. Higher score indicates more severe Parkinson's disease symptoms.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) - Tremor
outcomeMeasures.description: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale - Tremor subscale ranges from 0-23. Higher score indicates more severe Parkinson's disease symptoms.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) - Bulbar
outcomeMeasures.description: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale - Bulbar maximum score 24, minimum score of 0. Higher score indicates more severe Parkinson's disease symptoms.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Parkinson's Disease Questionnaire (PDQ) - 39 - Overall
outcomeMeasures.description: Parkinson's Disease Questionnaire (PDQ-39) Total. Range 0-100. Lower score indicates a better perceived health status.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Parkinson's Disease Questionnaire (PDQ) - 39 - Emotional Well-Being
outcomeMeasures.description: Parkinson's Disease Questionnaire (PDQ-39) - Emotional Well-Being maximum score 24, minimum score of 0.Lower score indicates a better perceived health status.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Short Form 36 Health Survey - Mental Component Summary
outcomeMeasures.description: Short Form 36 Health Survey. Range 0-100. Higher score indicates a better perceived quality of life.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Short Form 36 Health Survey - Vitality
outcomeMeasures.description: Short Form 36 Health Survey - Vitality subscale ranges from 0-100. Higher score indicates a better perceived quality of life.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Short Form 36 Health Survey - Role-Emotional
outcomeMeasures.description: Short Form 36 Health Survey - Emotional subscale ranges from 0-100. Higher score indicates a better perceived quality of life.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Short Form 36 Health Survey - Mental Health
outcomeMeasures.description: Short Form 36 Health Survey - Mental Health subscale ranges from 0-100. Higher score indicates a better perceived quality of life.
